results.title: Another balls-aching week
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Last governor”.
The handover approaches and there is no let up on Patten. Word and deeds by China confirm many people’s worst fears. Issues, major and minor, from a resolution to the British passports conflict, to the fate of Government House crockery must be finalised. This last program in the series charts the closing months of British rule in the leadup to the 30th June 1997 when the British flag will be lowered for the last time.

results.title: The Last governor
results.brief_description: This series profile the years 1992-1997 when Chris Patten, the last governor of Hong Kong worked to negotiate the handing over of the sovereignty of Hong Kong from Britain to China. Written and presented by Jonathan Dimbleby.

results.title: Revolt into style
results.creator_credit: Mark Worth, Simon Burton and Kind Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: Documentary about Melbourne’s Fashion Design Council (FDC) and the hey-day of 1980’s Austalian fashion -a time when models skipped and danced down the catwalk to the sounds of analogue synth pop. Fueled by the energy of the DIY Punk and New wave scene the FDC was formally established in 1984 and made fashion a crucial part of the Art School/Music nexus of underground creativity in Melbourne.

results.title: Return to Eden [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Karen Arthur, Hal McElroy and Eden Productions
results.brief_description: With a cast of over the top characters and a sprinkling of nudity, “Return to Eden” was Australia’s take on the American soap scene. It boasted a budget of over $1 million dollars on designer frocks, glamorous cars and copious amounts of hair gel. The plot centres around multi-millionaire Stephanie Harper (Rebecca Gilling), orphaned age 23 and inheriting her father’s mining fortune as well as the palatial estate, Eden. Two unsuccessful marriages later and dowdy Stephanie is about to walk down the aisle for the third time with smooth, gold-digging tennis champion, Greg Marsden (David Reyne). Loyalties are divided between friends and lovers when Stephanie’s best friend Jilly (a devilish Wendy Hughes) and her smarmy husband commence an affair. In the now infamous scene, Greg pushes Stephanie into the jaws of a crocodile. Surviving the attack with mainly facial injuries, Stephanie undergoes reconstructive facial surgery to look, remarkably, like her former self. Returning to Sydney, Stephanie reinvents herself as a glamorous model called Tara and introduces herself to the lives of Jilly and Greg who no longer recognise her thanks to the canny use of make-up, a change of wardrobe and a natty new hairdo. Stephanie/Tara manages to convince Greg to take her back to Eden, her old home and the scene where it all began. Filmed on location in the Northern Territory, New South Wales and Queensland, watch this film for a moving tribute to eighties fashion set to a Brian May musical score. Eager to push the boundaries of credibility and good taste that had already been crossed, 22 episodes were made to continue the saga and to include many more Australian actors in the star studded cast. Written by Michael Lawrence and produced for Network 10.

results.title: Responsible assertion (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows assertive, unassertive and aggressive responses to certain situations. Talks about the rights of individuals in personal confrontations. Shows how to be responsibly assertive, instead of being aggressive or unassertive.

results.title: Return of the Jedi
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Howard Kazanjian and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: The conclusion of the “Star Wars” trilogy begins with the rescue of Hans Solo from the evil clutches of Jabba the Hutt. The Galactic Empire has resurrected the Death Star and plans to eliminate the Rebel Alliance once and for all. Luke Skywalker, grappling with the secret that Darth Vader is his father, who was turned evil by the Dark Side of the Force, must confront the Emperor in one final battle. From the seedy den of Jabba the Hutt, to the luscious green peacefulness of the planet Endor with its Ewoks, “The Return of the Jedi” is an entralling action-packed special effects adventure.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

results.title: Return journey: a tribute to Burke and Wills
results.creator_credit: John Sherman, William Sterling and Albatross Film Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Re-enacts the 1861 expedition of Burke and Wills, with emphasis on the return journey north across the continent of Australia. Relates the rigours and heartbreaks of the expedition, culminating in the deaths of the explorers at Cooper Creek.

results.title: Return journey
results.creator_credit: Ian Potts, Arts Council of Great Britain and Worktown Production
results.brief_description: The film traces the development and usage of the documentary photograph through the work of three photographers, Humphrey Spender, Derek Smith and Jimmy Forsyth. It presents a unique record of English working class life from the 30’s to the 50’s. Narration by Ray Gosling.

results.title: Return home [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, Cristina Pozzan and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Noel, divorced and middle-aged, takes a break from his high pressure job in a big corporation to visit his brother, who, with his wife, is struggling to hang onto a barely viable small business - a service station in Adelaide. Gary, the 19 year old apprentice is struggling to come to terms with the complexities of life as an emerging adult and befriends Noel. Before long, Noel rediscovers the pleasures of family and is revitalised. After his return to Melbourne, his brother Gary and wife Judy, reassess their own lives and begin to see their own potential. Noel eventually returns to Adelaide for good; his journey for happiness, security and a future filled with promise is finally over. Ray Argall’s direction gives form and substance to everyday lives, with a sense of naturalism apparent. Stars Dennis Coard, Frankie J. Holden, Ben Mendelsohn and Micki Camilleri. Cinematography by Mandy Walker. Also available on VHS [305270].

results.title: Retirement income perils
results.creator_credit: Sally Wiadrowski and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In this “4 Corners” special, reporter Chris Masters investigates an area which is causing plenty of grey hairs - Retirement Investment Planning - RIP. This is an overview of the efficacy of superannuation savings and how it will or will not allow people to live comfortably after retirement.
